result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Ortiz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-18-15 Court order imposing 2 days of condition time.

Defendant Orlando Ortiz in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 2 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
No review hearing scheduled.

Defendant Orlando Ortiz in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Dawn Muldonado.
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 16 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during the period of probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

15RM034899  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-24-2015

Defendant Orlando Ortiz in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
All other conditions of bail remain the same.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Emily Hoffmann.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.   Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for September 15, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 36.

Defendant Orlando Ortiz in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.B.M-T DOB 8/1/71.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Orlando Ortiz in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Orlando Ortiz in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Orlando Ortiz in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Orlando Ortiz in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
